Package model

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Inventory for parts and products is held in this class. Methods to delete parts & products, add, search via ID/full/partial names, and update are also available. Note: allParts and allProducts are the fields as required by UML.
Author:
Alexander Cowan

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part newPart)
      In the method below, this allows for a new part to be added to "Inventory". On the "Main Screen" the part is displayed when correctly added.
      Parameters:
      newPart - the new part to be added

    • lookupPart

      public static Part lookupPart(int partId)
      In the method below, it allows to search parts by EXACT part IDs utilizing the "Lookup Method". An exact match is returned if one exist after the method is called. Note: When it is called, the lookup parses the current parts in inventory and provides the basis for all future lookups in the application. Lookup part is a required static method as noted in the UML diagram. We will see the other methods below follow the same pathway within this class.
      Parameters:
      partId - the part id to be searched for
      Returns:
      The part matching the search ID criteria (only if a part is found).

    • lookupPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupPart(String partName)
      In the method below, it allows to search by partial or exact part names. Current parts in the inventory are checked when this method is called then returns an exact or partial match if one or more exist. Similar to the alert statements, we are matching the class "Part" with the local variable of "part" for clarity.
      Parameters:
      partName - the part name to be searched for
      Returns:
      The part or parts matching the search text criteria, either exact matches or if the string is found at any point within part names (only if at least one part name or part of a part name is found).

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int uniqueId, Part selectedPart)
      In the method below, another variant of lookup is used for updating parts. When this is called it takes an existing part which is being modified and replaces the part in the inventory using a part ID.
      Parameters:
      uniqueId - the id of the part to be updated
      selectedPart - is the chosen part to be updated

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      In the method below, we delete a part. A part is removed from the all parts list when called.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the chosen part to be deleted

    • getAllParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
      In the method below, we see the operation to grab all parts via the getter. All parts in the inventory are returned when this method is called.
      Returns:
      All parts currently in the inventory.

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      In the method below, we see the ability to add a new product to inventory. In the table on the main screen, the product is displayed once successfully added.
      Parameters:
      newProduct - the new product to be added

    • lookupProduct

      public static Product lookupProduct(int productId)
      In the method below, we see the ability to search products using the exact "product ID". Similar to above, the inventory is parsed for an exact ID match when called. Note: class "Product" is matched to variable/parameter "product" for clarity.
      Parameters:
      productId - the product id to be searched for
      Returns:
      The product matching the search ID criteria (only if a product is found).

    • lookupProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct(String productName)
      In the method below, we see the ability to search for partial or exact names (product names). The inventory is parsed, then returns an exact or partial match if one or more exist when called.
      Parameters:
      productName - the product name to be searched for
      Returns:
      The product or products matching the search text criteria, either exact matches or if the string is found at any point within product names (only if at least one product name or part of a product name is found).

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int uniqueId, Product newProduct)
      In the method below, the ability to update a product is shown. Similar to code above, the existing product which is being modified then replaces the corresponding existing product in the inventory via the 'Product ID".
      Parameters:
      uniqueId - the id of the product to be updated
      newProduct - the selected product to be updated

    • deleteProduct

      public static boolean deleteProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      In the method below, we see the ability to delete a product. In the inventory a product is deleted when this method is called.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - is the selected product to be deleted

    • getAllProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getAllProducts()
      In the method below, we see the ability to grab all get products. All items in the inventory are returned once this method is called.
      Returns:
      All products currently in the inventory.
